data.text:
Johnnie Lee Wright 79 of Leominster Ma also known to our family in the South as “Buddy”, passed away peacefully on August 23, 2022.

Johnnie was born July 23, 1943 in Americus, Georgia, son of Harry and Lillie Ruth Wright. Johnnie grew up in a small town, Sebring Florida and resided there throughout his childhood. Upon graduation from high school, Johnnie joined the Army and served during the Vietnam War. While serving in the Army, Johnnie met the love of his life, a Miss Margaret Gomez, whom was also serving in the Army. After serving in the Military, Johnnie received honorable discharge and became a long-term employee at Foster Grant, Digital, and retiring with Intel Corp.

Johnnie was an amazing man with an infectious smile. In his spare time, he loved to hunt, fish, golf, go for motorcycle rides, kayaking, and spending time with his grandchildren. Johnnie played on various baseball teams and golf leagues. Johnnie was also drafted into the major leagues for the Cincinnati Reds.

Johnnie was a loving husband, father, and grandfather. He leaves behind his wife of 51 years, Margaret G. Wright, his two daughters Andrea Tourigny and her husband Scott Tourigny, Lisa Wright, grandchildren, Jarred Beauregard, Jayden Notermann, Mia Eppy, and Hannah Eppy, as well as many extended family and many friends.

Calling hours for Johnnie will be held on Tuesday, August 30,2022 from 1~3pm at Richardson Funeral Home, 106 West St. Leominster, with a service at 3pm. Burial with military honors will be held at a later date in Massachusetts Veterans Memorial Cemetery, Winchendon.

Johnnie/Daddy/Papa… we will miss you….

Thank you for Loving Us…

Thank you for being our Hero….

“We only wanted to see you laughing in the Purple Rain”
